comment.author: 29079609@N02
comment._content: Karl Boy-Ed (1872-1930) served as Germany's naval attaché to the U.S. until his eventual expulsion as a saboteur shortly before the U.S. entered the war in 1917. www.firstworldwar.com/bio/boy-ed.htm

comment.author: 66311327@N05
comment._content: Another picture of Boy-Ed with comments:

comment.author: 76016463@N00
comment._content: firstworldwar.com's account of the timing seems to be wrong. This photo, from December, 1915, is Boy-Ed on the Holland-America Line's SS Rotterdam, departing Hoboken, New Jersey for Europe on the occasion of his expulsion from the U.S on December 28, 1915. chroniclingamerica.loc.gov/lccn/sn83030214/1915-12-29/ed-...

comment.author: 34904489@N07
comment._content: artolog: Thanks for tracking down the New York Tribune article from December 29, 1915, which describes Boy-Ed as the "recently detached naval attaché" in a great turn of phrase.  We will update this photo and the other of Boy-Ed to reflect these dates and info.
